![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

This is February's Turing-Roche newsletter! Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and wider relevant networks.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FqC0WdmvlqRMSRq4DZEWVqw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202021489%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kKQuj3DgkI15u5kNUCqAuKi38Djd%2BQ0CGJqkaFy6%2Bqg%3D&reserved=0) was officially launched in June 2021. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We are developing multiple research activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the broader community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FykUm0IGj76dxyz7pUWQiPw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202027459%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=4dq%2FnFPE%2BcsyolRsTzo7j8qYSpxR%2BAOtx%2BC2X9wljJc%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Translational Science Methods Club Event: Factor Analysis in Psychiatry

**26 February 2024**

Run by our Turing-Roche Community Scholar, Sarah Buehler, the Translational Science Methods (T-SciM) Club series aims to bring together the community to discuss different methods that help us translate from data to science to clinic.

This second event in the series will be on data-driven dimensionality reduction applied to transdiagnostic clinical dimensions in psychiatry, to optimise the explanation of individual differences. We will be joined by Celine Fox, who is currently completing her PhD research in Psychology at Trinity College Dublin, where she is developing clinical tools that can predict the future course of mental health problems on an individualised basis.

More information on the event and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2FZ5Gq_BlHBHuX-m38ipLyWA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202033499%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=H7Vh2MYi6vQ3pYA65KCbme80mvB5%2Fbd4%2B%2FrlxR4STJU%3D&reserved=0).

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Mining higher-order triadic interactions

**27 February 2024**

Join us for our monthly [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FuyDgxL_3LiQ4yega3dHy8g&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202041178%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=9v8rSAdRToYJ3oC392bXQmG2ogYicYkOM30uNRDxvn8%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to hear partnership research updates and share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

February's event is on the 27th and we will be hearing from Anthony Baptista, Postdoctoral Research Associate with the Turing-Roche Partnership and Queen Mary University of London. Anthony will introduce his recent work, proposing a novel information-theoretic approach to quantify triadic interactions in missing data and also applying this to gene-expression data. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2FiM7OmaRC6MoPMFn2Tqn4GA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202046819%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=XtATBB2senG1p0dF3vVT8KWhnbBeQQSXXxfIzjSIbLs%3D&reserved=0). 

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fo8-3Jg_ktA4xPi1XKAuPmg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202052548%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=XMJG8NkQ00ZtuiIAh86rcpy2N06wX30llC8o9BPxpnU%3D&reserved=0).

## Current News and Opportunities from The Alan Turing Institute and Roche
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### New Speakers Announced for AI UK Conference

NASA's Jacqueline Le Moigne and Google DeepMind's Dorothy Chou are amongst the second wave of speakers announced for AI UK, the UK's national conference for data science and AI, organised by the Turing Institute, which is taking place in London on the 19-20 March 2024. The conference is thematically structured around the latest innovations from across the AI ecosystem, with health being a major theme.

The partnership will have a demonstration stand at the conference and partnership Senior Research Associates Rohan Chakraborty and Chris Banerji will also be giving a talk on 'Different flavours of AI transparency for personalised healthcare'. You can find the full programme and register for tickets [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2FQNne7FY4HnUESXFzKT0USw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202059748%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MqFU7GOu23EnKLx%2FlWsNBDDqQZONUYb3mBHT2AutrNA%3D&reserved=0).

### Expression of Interest for Health Data Research UK (HDR UK) and Roche Hackathon

HDRUK and Roche are organising a spring hackathon on the topic of 'Using machine learning to predict the effects of protein mutations'. The event will take place at the Wellcome Collection in London from the 17-19 April 2024. Following the workshop, participants will have an opportunity to apply for exclusive Roche internships. Formal applications will open shortly, in the meantime you can complete [this form](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_%2FO6y1wcYj0dZY3WAmlI9J3w&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202065349%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=DvW78nxBxTj51XHUPmm5j5y9TRrCbnHH4%2F2XPGDhwd4%3D&reserved=0) to register your interest.

## Events
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### Health Data Research UK (HDR UK) and Hardian Health: Bringing Software as a Medical Device to Market
**21-22 February 2024**

Register for this two-day in-person course at the Wellcome Trust in London, with Hardian Health's multidisciplinary team, brought to you by HDR UK. The course consists of four half-day workshops, focusing on interactivity and engagement through round table discussions, exercises, and practical examples.

The aim is to equip early-stage innovators with the confidence and knowledge needed for proper health-tech market entry, including strategic decision-making, streamlined regulatory processes, robust clinical and economic evidence, and intellectual property protection. This course is aimed at those with a solid foundational idea, potentially with a prototype product and clear intended use. Further info and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fe3ef9hC2UoGSO70uBlasDA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202084338%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=O%2FnJvDmdTfRt2RE5HQqdXGWHF3zaG3fAx6ntwYzBlXA%3D&reserved=0).

### Turing Clinical AI Interest Group Seminar: AI for Women's Health

**07 March 2024**

Turing's [Clinical AI Interest Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FHsI_Qmzm4FcDAW9EwsCD1Q&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202099765%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=iHEEMN9tDM1xgrpC2vam6O9AbexFL0ZDJBrRf3SHVi0%3D&reserved=0) has formed supra-interest groups in different clinical specialties to bring together clinicians and AI experts in a more focused manner. The AI for Women's Health supra-interest group is hosting a virtual event in March with talks from:

-   Dilara Tank, Masters student visiting University of Cambridge: 'A Systematic Review of AI-Automated Segmentation in Transvaginal Ultrasound Scans'.
-   Stephan Romanov, PhD Student at University of Manchester: 'Deep learning for breast cancer risk prediction'.

Register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2F4sq0ahQ2R-e8AxJpd41Ztw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202106819%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=PUZkDFZtrXtpXnZ8F25lJ%2B4xcYza5cz0Agwcqbbh2Uo%3D&reserved=0).

### Imperial College London Workshop: Latest Developments in Physics-Informed Machine Learning

**Flash talk/poster submission deadline: 01 March 2024**

**Event: 18 March 2024**

This event is a collaboration between the Turing Institute, Data Science Institute, the National Heart and Lung Institute at Imperial, the Leeds Institute for Data Analytics and the Leeds Institute for Fluid Dynamics. It aims to cover the latest developments in this area across disciplines with keynotes from Dr Alice Cicirello (University of Cambridge) and Prof Nathan Kutz (University of Washington and the Turing Institute). There is an opportunity to present your research at the workshop through a flash talk and/or poster. Find out more [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_%2FHc8bZt6ZyQYGnTawaOggmQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202114121%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=HGUv2iDnUynQfWMy4ZLmvEgTwjLFsz0jyAxKvdm4JFA%3D&reserved=0).

### TRIC-DT Seminar Series Event: Crafting Digital Twins- How computational modeling can design clinical trials for patients who are not average

**11 March 2024- 10am GMT**

The [Turing Research and Innovation Cluster in Digital Twins](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2FyICamRb4t1U5qGtIGMZfRg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202119764%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2FCq53IHuVOKWejhqajmehOiLOnUz2BFI9yH3jfR%2FFyU%3D&reserved=0) (TRIC-DT) runs a seminar series to serve as an interdisciplinary platform to discuss computational methods, algorithms, and models underpinning Digital Twin technology across diverse fields. Their next event is on the 11th March at 10am GMT, where they will be joined by speaker Prof. Thomas E. Yankeelov (Oden Institute for Computational Engineering and Science) who will be giving a talk on 'How computational modeling can design clinical trials for patients who are not average'. The Zoom link for the event is [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FPNp4SNmfBPE4ME3ugnrdog&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202125551%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=o1tXfJ52OPHQ3Q7aoSSHCc1shr8itTMjygMv4P5u3lY%3D&reserved=0).

### BS-IMS World Congress Pre-Meeting for Young Researchers 2024

**10-11 August 2024**

The [2024 World Congress](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F42Sn4338gnXo_NzdOWBZ3A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202131047%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=JeQldk2Dz9K7Zc1Zs1BRgUvLsFboRMzh0oo2dcjXpqQ%3D&reserved=0) in Probability and Statistics is the 11th in a series of conferences organized every four years under the auspices of the Bernoulli Society and the Institute of Mathematical Statistics. The conference is having a pre-meeting for young researchers at an early stage of their academic career. Participants will be given the opportunity to learn about selected modern research directions at the interface of probability and statistics, and to participate in discussions that pertain to career development. A further focus is to enable young researchers to network among their peer group. There are currently confirmed speakers for lectures on Conformal Inference, Networks and Reinforcement Learning. More info and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2FBXjeaj7LnyE8QVNhoY4y6A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202136597%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QH1JE5ZPdjhYcoyZZxUh9wC3HWf4sS5JeT6axiIFTLg%3D&reserved=0).

### New Journal: AI in Precision Oncology

Our partnership lead Sarah McGough has joined the editorial board of a new journal, [AI in Precision Onclogy](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FXGUvUs6lnuRG-x40hVsohA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202142038%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pBo8qmFUBRULwVGLFO9PcoqawCOghJqFeiBPyEiBqmk%3D&reserved=0). The journal publishes original research articles, reviews, and perspectives on the application of AI in cancer research, diagnosis, and treatment, bringing together researchers, clinicians, and industry experts to share their knowledge and experience in this rapidly evolving field. Interested in contributing? [Submit a paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FrGSG4kUJhLwpyjv9XgjBhw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202149287%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=FQ8gnnIqKuClEj6O7DWsxZ1ZXBjFy1iWthCXFVAz1VU%3D&reserved=0) to be featured in the April edition in print at ASCO, or reach out to Sarah (<mcgough.sarah@gene.com>) if interested in joining the editorial board.

## Featured Community Scholar of the Month

In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for 12 months to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FXJ4pyynqnsrOeRBnVXq1sg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202208922%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=IGiklfHLb%2BxRBDgnqP8E%2BDerDl%2Bd485n4ZSgyw0zYR0%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FddWZ7_2Sd3jhKdMJOUGtfg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202214293%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=mUfsv5MGOi5YSx7OgFQIVE2q2in%2Bt2uQubJ%2B7oG1%2Fug%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Florence Townend, from University College London.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/florencetownend_avatar1.jpeg)

**Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

My name's Florence and I'm from Reading in Berkshire but now I'm living in East London. I'm a second-year PhD student at UCL using AI and neuroimaging to predict how long somebody with motor neuron disease (MND, a fatal neurodegenerative condition) will survive. So far, I've been collecting deep-learning methods that combine information from MRI and clinical data, and I've developed a Python library called "fusilli" for people to try these methods out for themselves. Next steps are to use "fusilli" to see if information from brain MRI can help to predict lifespans of MND patients, with the goal of improving clinical trial design and understanding more about this condition's progression.

**What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you? **

I'm developing a podcast alongside a fellow scholar, Davy Tennison, about how AI and data science can be applied to healthcare. Since my PhD focuses on the technical aspects of AI for healthcare, and Davy's PhD is about the philosophy of science and more ethical aspects of medicine, we thought discussing current research together would bring about some interesting conversations and we'd each learn something new from it.

**Which object do you misplace or lose the most?**

Lip balms. Specifically the Burts Bees Beeswax Lipbalm (not #ad but I wouldn't be opposed, Burt, if you're listening). I bulk-ordered 30 of them off Amazon because I kept losing them and I'm so upset if I'm anywhere without at least 3 on my person. Now they're hidden in every pocket of every bag and coat. Maybe I'll wean myself off them one day, but today is not that day!

## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

**Multimodal brain age estimation using interpretable adaptive population-graph learning**

This month's selected publication is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWd0RkZzQnpyaGI2YmJPaFc2QTA4RTdpWVgwTlQyS2o5WUZ6b21XYlJsMWxieFF2X20zaVpQRi1CWlpqN2picGkmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi0yOTY4ODVlMmQ2ODY0NzM5ODRjYTk0NjE1MTdhYTM1OCZlc2lkPTVlY2E4ZjUwLTJmY2ItZWUxMS05MDc5LTYwNDViZDBlNmJmZSJ9%2FQ_wqQCdH7I0GXBmI_zheFQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7Cac81e4ebb4fb4bae44eb08dc31336e0c%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638439344202219783%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qmQsm9wmlUu%2BjNCWuMpFoEDF5Focy7NBu1GRsppUgak%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Florence Townend. 

'This is a cool paper about the concept of "brain age", which is how old somebody's brain looks. A good analogy to this is when you see somebody's hands, you can guess how old they are, and if they've got really young-looking hands, you might think "wow, what hand cream do they use". Brain age is the same concept, except instead of attributing a younger-looking brain to hand cream, you might wonder if they've got some sort of medical condition that is altering how old their brain looks. For example, an older-looking brain has been linked to several neurodegenerative diseases. There are quite a few ways to predict brain age, and deep learning has proven to be pretty popular recently. This paper suggests a new graph convolutional neural network model that incorporates brain MRI and non-imaging data to make interpretable brain age predictions.'
